page.title: 18LIFESTYLE:COSHESTON/PEMBROKE
page.content: We did a survey on 17 Cosheston Children and 17 Pembroke children. This is what we found out: Most of the Cosheston children were not born there. They had moved into the area. Their families lived in more expensive houses, they all had cars and 6 of them had 2 cars. There were fewer unemployed Fathers in Cosheston, but more Pembroke Mothers worked. Family sizes were similar (2 or 3 children). Every family in both places had TVs & record players. Nearly all of them had telephones & bicycles. Half of both groups had videos, but more Pembroke children had computers. The childrens games and hobbies were very similar and they all watched a lot of television. Most of them had pets,dogs and cats being most popular. Maths and English were the favourite school subjects in both places.
